Class Card

  • java.lang.Object
    • Card
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Card>

    public class Card
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Card>
    This class will be used to create Card objects.
    Author:
    AnneMarie Caballero

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int CLUBS_INT
      the integer value assigned to the clubs suit
      static int DIAMONDS_INT
      the integer value assigned to the diamonds suit
      static int HEARTS_INT
      the integer value assigned to the hearts suit
      private int rank
      the rank value of the Card assignments of ranks that don't directly match to a number: 1 = ace, 11 = jack, 12 = queen, 13 = king
      static int SPADES_INT
      the integer value assigned to the spades suit
      private java.lang.String suit
      the suit value of the Card could be: "Clubs", "Hearts", "Diamonds", or "Spades"

      Constructs a default card (the Ace of Clubs)

      Constructs a Card using two integers

      Constructs a Card using a integer, for suit, and String, for rank.
      Card​(java.lang.String s, int r)
      Constructs a Card using a String, for suit, and integer, for rank.
      Card​(java.lang.String s, java.lang.String r)
      Constructs a Card using two Strings

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo​(Card other)
        Compares two Card objects using both suit and rank
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Card>
        Parameters:
        other - the Card that this Card is being compared to.
        Returns:
        1 if the Card is greater than other, -1 if this is less than other and 0 if the two Cards being compared are equal.
        See Also:
        Comparable.compareTo(java.lang.Object)

        public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object other)
        Checks if two Cards are equal
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        other - the Card that this Card is being checked for equality with
        Returns:
        true if the Cards are equal, false if the Cards are unequal

      • getSuitStr

        private static java.lang.String getSuitStr​(int s)
                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the String value of a suit given as an integer. Used internally to reduce redundancy of constructors where suit is given as an integer.
        Parameters:
        s - the integer version of suit that will be used to find the String equivalent
        Returns:
        the String equivalent of integer s
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the int given doesn't have a String equivalent for suit

      • getRankInt

        private static int getRankInt​(java.lang.String r)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the integer value of a given String rank. Is used internally to get the equivalent integer value of a rank given as String to reduce redundancy in constructors where rank is given as a String.
        Parameters:
        r - the String value of the rank that it gets the int for
        Returns:
        the equivalent integer value to the rank held by String r
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if String r doesn't have an equivalent integer rank
